SEARCH

Class SortedStack

java.lang.Object
SortedStack
public class SortedStack extends Object
A program that reads a list of integers from user input, stores them in a Stack, and sorts them in ascending order.

This program uses the Java Collections Framework to handle the sorting of the Stack.

In order to run this program, run the following commands:

 javac SortedStack.java
 java SortedStack

In order to generate the javadoc for this code, run the following command:

 javadoc -d doc -private SortedStack.java

Documents can then be found in the generated doc/ folder

Since:
CSC6301 - Module 4

  • Field Details

    • numbers

      private Stack<Integer> numbers
      A Stack that stores the integers read from user input.

  • Constructor Details

    • SortedStack

      public SortedStack()

      Constructs a SortedStack object.

      Initializes the Stack that will store the integers. This demonstrates code reuse by utilizing Java's existing Stack implementation.

  • Method Details

    • readInput

      private void readInput()
      Reads integers from user input using a Scanner. The user can enter integers separated by spaces or new lines. Input ends when the user types "done". Each integer entered is added to the Stack numbers.

    • outputStack

      private void outputStack()
      Prints the sorted Stack of integers stored in numbers to the console.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The entry point of the program. Creates an instance of SortedStack, reads user input, sorts the Stack using Collections.sort(List), and prints the sorted Stack.
      NOTE: Typically sorting a Stack defeats the purpose of the Data Structure's Last-In-First-Out format, though since the assignment calls for the sorting of this item, we are going to sort it in this main function.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments (not used).
